Header.title: MOOClet
Header.paragraph: Unifying Experimentation, Dynamic Improvement & Personalization in Online Courses

About.paragraph: A MOOClet is a digital component – like an explanation in an online course or problem – designed using the MOOClet technology. This technology enables instructors and researchers to engage in a wide range of A/B experimentation, crowdsourcing, real-time data analysis, and personalization.

Services.name: Providing general description of our framework and approach
Services.text: Mohi Reza, Juho Kim, Ananya Bhattacharjee, Anna N. Rafferty, and Joseph Jay Williams. 2021. The MOOClet Framework: Unifying Experimentation, Dynamic Improvement, and Personalization in Online Courses. In Proceedings of the Eighth ACM Conference on Learning @ Scale (L@S '21). Association for Computing Machinery, New York, NY, USA, 15–26. DOI:https://doi.org/10.1145/3430895.3460128

Services.name: Providing examples of instructional interventions for CS classrooms:
Services.text: Thomas W. Price, Joseph Jay Williams, Jaemarie Solyst, and Samiha Marwan. 2020. Engaging Students with Instructor Solutions in Online Programming Homework. In Proceedings of the 2020 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems (CHI '20). Association for Computing Machinery, New York, NY, USA, 1–7. DOI:https://doi.org/10.1145/3313831.3376857

Services.name: Describing proof of concept of dynamic interventions authoring:
Services.text: Joseph Jay Williams, Anna N. Rafferty, Dustin Tingley, Andrew Ang, Walter S. Lasecki, and Juho Kim. 2018. Enhancing Online Problems Through Instructor-Centered Tools for Randomized Experiments. Proceedings of the 2018 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems. Association for Computing Machinery, New York, NY, USA, Paper 207, 1–12. DOI:https://doi.org/10.1145/3173574.3173781

Services.name: Providing examples of randomized evaluations of data-driven interventions for CS classrooms:
Services.text: Thomas W. Price, Samiha Marwan, and Joseph Jay Williams. 2021. Exploring Design Choices in Data-driven Hints for Python Programming Homework. In Proceedings of the Eighth ACM Conference on Learning @ Scale (L@S '21). Association for Computing Machinery, New York, NY, USA, 283–286. DOI:https://doi.org/10.1145/3430895.3460159

Contact.address: 40 St George St, Toronto, ON M5S 2E4

Features.title: Implementation of Online Field Experiments
Features.text: One use of the MOOClet Framework is to turn a static educational resource (webpage, explanation, problem, email, discussion forum) into an adaptive resource that can be continually improved and personalized as more students use it and new ideas emerge

Features.title: Accelerating Improvement of Educational Resources using Data from Experiments
